text: Bottle, thanks to Marko! You rock! Opaque black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of chocolate, licorice, pumpernickel, raw sugar, dried fruit, raisins, vanilla and light boost. Taste is very light sweet and medium bitter with notes of coffee, chocolate, licorice, raw sugar and dried fruit. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Tasty beverage.

Pitch black with minimal sized brown head. Nice dark chocolate aroma, lots of cocoa, some vanilla coming from the background. Roasted malt; nice Christmas chocolate cake. Lovely chocolate at first, than lots of vanilla, cake, biscuit, even a little hint of smokey notes. Complex and well balanced stuff. Medium body, soft carbonated, very creamy. Just great. Bottled version is even greater. One of the top 3 Croatian brews so far definitely!

Bottle courtesy of Iznogud, thank you! Black color, big bright tan head. Nice aroma of dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla. The vanilla doesnt overwhelm the taste, slightly sweet but with an earthy dry finish. Nice.

Bottle. Medium-high carbonation, full body. Subtle vanilla in the flavour smoothing out the moderately roasty chocolatey malt character. Well balanced, alcohol in the background. Easy drinking, tasty. Very good.

Bottle, kindly donated by OgiVlado, shared by Gurthnar., many thanks. Very dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffe, caramel, vanilla. Taste, coffee, roasted malt, licorice, vanilla. Very good.

Bottle at train shared by Gurthnar, many thanks. Pours black color, beige head. Aroma of vanilla, roasted malt, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate. Taste is sweet, medium bitter, roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, whisky. Nice roasted coffee finish.
0,33 l bottle. dark brown color , creamy head ,sweet, coffee, chocolate and vanilla flavors. bitter finish. i love it
0.33l bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, caramel and coffee. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, caramel and light bitterness. Overall its very good beer.

On tap at Craft Room and at the Ljetno Kino Tukanac. pours black with nice looking medium beige head. Malty, roasted, chocolate, lots of vanilla, bit lactic, wood. Sweet with roasted bitter finish. Medium carbonation. Medium bodied. Nice one.
On tap. Black coloured beer with tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, malt, vanilla. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium carbonated.
A very nice and balanced of roasted coffee with vanilla, lingers in your mouth. Hope it will not be just a one off series.

#1136Tap. Literally black, small beige head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is sweetish-bitter. Coffee, chocolate, dried fruits, vanilla, warming alcohol presence. Aftertaste is full of very dark chocolate. Medium body, higher carbonation. Pleasant.
Draught at BeerGeek Bar. Brown to black colored. AROMA- roasted malts, vanilla, coffee. FLAVOR- neutral, chocolate, vanilla, roasted. Medium bodied. Quite good.

Hvala mom prijatelju Goranu iz picerije Viva na ovom odlicnom pivu...super zanimljivo flasiranje u boci zapecacenom bijelim voskom.. Luksuzno pakiranje daje dodatnu vrijednost ovom pivu...super boja...okus cokoladni ali gorak...slatkasto gorko iskustvo...nije za svakog ali onaj tko voli Porter piva ?e zavoljeti i ovo pivo...iznenadjujuce dobro pivo
Taster at brewpub, nitro boosted. Black color with great brown head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, milk, and coffee. Taste is bitter and sweet.
On tap at brewery, 0.3L. Black color with big brown head. Chocolate and some coffee aroma. Sweet taste. Chocolate aftertaste. Finally Garden with their prime beer.

Black color, small brownish head. Discrete roasty aroma, light vanilla and cocoa. Taste is moderate malty, cocoa, light vanilla, caramel. This is not really "in your face" type of beer as I hoped, but still manages to be tasty and enjoyable.

Black colored, thick, small not very lasting tan head. Aroma is of strong milk and dark chocolate, vanilla, cocoa powder, some lactose. Taste is medium+ sweet malt, milky chocolate, cocoa nibs, vanilla, roasted malt, bit lactose, medium bitterness, dryish finish. Medium+ bodied, soft+ carbonation, creamy. Fine!
(on tap, Craft Room, Zagreb)

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2017 Beige head, deep black color. Malty, roasty aroma, also some chocolate, molasses. Taste is smoky, malty, some chocolate and coffee. You can also pick up some subtle vanilla notes, ends with nice roastiness. Smooth, it could be fuller, but it is still the best from The Garden.

On tap at Ljetno Kino Tukanac event Zagreb. Deep black coloured, small to medium sized brownish head, chocolate and vanilla in the nose. Roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate, notes of cocoa and sugar with mild roasty finish. Smooth and easy-drinkable.

On tap at Craft Room, Opatovina, Zagreb. Marko thanks for sharing and for a great presentation. Dark brown, murky with red tint, small off-white to tan head. Strong milk chocolate aroma, cocoa, roasty, light wood and peat. Very sweet, chocolate flavors, like chocolate milk. Medium body, soft to medium carbonation, lasting roasty finish. Very aromatic, very interesting, great for those who love a sweeter porter.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2017 On tap @below zero temperatures at the Ljetno Kino Tukanac release event. A damn shame for the first commercial Croatian wood aged beer! Almost black body with a brownish head. Light soft aroma, vanilla, malty, vague chocolate. The taste goes the same way, soft, slightly subdued, vanilla, cocoa and maltiness. Over time, tried later on, proved to be an excellent beer that grew taste-wise as time went on.
